intro: Cyphanthera scabrella, commonly known as the scarlet burr. It is a flowering plant native to Australia, characterized by its distinctive, spiny pods that encase its seeds. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Cyphanthera scabrella is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to dry environments.
